items.title: Meet the 80 top-funded startups and tech companies in Southeast Asia
Sunrate to buy China’s Transfar Pay for $43m to gain license
items.summary:
- Transfar Logistics to sell its entire stake in Transfar Pay to Sunrate for $43 million.
- The acquisition is aimed at gaining compliance advantages in China's regulated cross-border payments sector.
- The deal awaits approval from China’s central bank and other regulatory bodies, with uncertain timelines.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Southeast Asia
US voice tech startup Sesame AI eyes $200m funding
items.author: Brendan Iribe, Ankit Kumar
items.summary:
- Sesame AI Inc. is seeking over US$200 million in funding from investors.
- Funding round may be co-led by Sequoia Capital and Spark Capital, potentially valuing Sesame AI at over US$1 billion.
- Founded in 2023, Sesame AI launched in February 2023 after raising US$47.5 million in a Series A round.
- The company's voice assistants, Maya and Miles, focus on creating more natural and emotionally resonant interactions.

items.title: Microsoft-backed AI firm faces audit, leadership changes
items.summary:
- Builder.ai engages two Big Four auditing firms for financial review for 2023 and 2024.
- Revenue estimates for H2 2024 reduced by 25% due to underperforming sales.
- The company raised over US$450 million and began revising sales figures last summer.
- Concerns raised about inflated sales figures by over 20% by former employees.
- New CEO Manpreet Ratia expects audit findings this summer to improve transparency and governance.
- Leadership changes include founder Sachin Dev Duggal stepping down as CEO in February.
- Projected revenue increased to US$170 million in 2024 from US$140 million in 2023, despite slower growth in Australia and Southeast Asia.

items.title: AI-powered cybersecurity firm ReliaQuest raises over $500m
items.summary:
- ReliaQuest has raised over US$500 million in its latest funding round.
- The company is valued at US$3.4 billion following the investment.
- Major investors include EQT, KKR, FTV Capital, and existing investors Ten Eleven Ventures and Finback Investment Partners.
- Funds will be used to enhance GreyMatter, an AI-driven platform, and for global expansion.
- GreyMatter integrates with over 200 cybersecurity tools to enhance threat detection and response.
- ReliaQuest's annual recurring revenue exceeds US$300 million with over 30% year-over-year growth since 2020.
- Goldman Sachs acted as the exclusive financial advisor; Gibson Dunn provided legal counsel.

items.title: US pushes for more semiconductor investments under Chips Act
items.summary:
- Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick urges companies to increase investments in the US semiconductor sector.
- Seeking tens of billions in additional investments without increasing the $52 billion from the 2022 Chips and Science Act.
- TSMC's decision to invest an extra $100 billion in US facilities prompts this push.
- Potential withholding of already awarded subsidies if companies don't expand their plans.
- Lutnick interested in expanding the Chips Act’s 25% tax credit, which requires Congressional approval for any significant changes.
- Companies like Wolfspeed Inc. face uncertainty due to delays in fund disbursements.
- President Donald Trump criticized the Chips Act and created the United States Investment Accelerator to oversee large projects and fund distribution.

items.title: Xiaomi investigated after its EV fatal crash in China
items.summary:
- Xiaomi is cooperating with police after a fatal accident involving its SU7 electric vehicle on March 29 in Anhui, China.
- The vehicle was in Navigate on Autopilot mode, traveling at 116 km/h before the crash.
- The driver attempted to regain control but collided with a cement pole at 97 km/h; casualties remain undisclosed.
- The SU7 involved does not have advanced LiDAR technology and uses a vision-based system for navigation.
- Investigations are ongoing.

items.title: Fantasy gaming firm Dream11 moves HQ from US to India
items.summary:
- Fantasy gaming platform Dream11 relocated its headquarters from the US to India.
- The merger of US entity Dream Sports Inc. with Indian entity Sporta Technologies Pvt Ltd was approved by the board in January 2025.
- Reasons for the move include enabling US shareholders to participate in the Indian company, reducing costs by eliminating inter-company transactions, and simplifying management structure.
- No plans for a public listing in India have been announced.

items.title: Huawei reports first quarterly loss in years
items.summary:
- Huawei reported a net loss of 300 million yuan (approximately US$41.3 million) for the December quarter, marking its first quarterly loss in several years.
- Revenue increased by 9.5% to around 276 billion yuan (around US$38 billion).
- The company invested 179.7 billion yuan (around US$24.76 billion) in R&D for 2024, a 9.1% increase from 2023.
- Smart driving solutions segment became profitable for the first time, with revenue more than quintupling last year.
- Consumer products group saw a 38% revenue increase in 2024.
- The cloud computing division grew by 8.5%, aided by demand for AI services and US sanctions affecting Nvidia GPUs.
- Core telecommunications business grew by 5%, facing challenges from US partnerships limitations.

items.title: Ex-Apple chip engineer returns to China, takes role at university
items.summary:
- An ex-Apple chip engineer has returned to China.
- He has accepted a position at a university.
- The move emphasizes a trend of tech talent returning to China.

items.title: Amazon launches new AI agent platform
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Amazon launched [nova.amazon.com](https://www.techinasia.com/news/amazon-launches-new-ai-agent-platform) on Mar. 31, featuring advanced generative AI models called Amazon Nova.
- The platform includes a research preview of the Amazon Nova Act SDK for web browsers, enabling developers to create agents for searching and interacting with web interfaces.
- The Amazon Nova suite offers models for text generation (Nova Micro, Lite, Pro) and media generation (Nova Canvas, Nova Reel), integrated with Amazon Bedrock for scalable solutions.
- US customers can experiment with tools for text, image, and video generation via the Nova Act SDK by signing in with their Amazon account.

items.title: Chinese AI firm launches model, claims to outperform DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Zhipu AI launched a free AI agent named AutoGLM Rumination for web searches, travel planning, and reports.
- CEO Zhang Peng introduced the product using proprietary technologies like the GLM-Z1-Air model.
- Zhipu claims its GLM-Z1-Air outperforms DeepSeek’s R1 in speed and efficiency.
- The launch is part of a broader trend of AI product releases in China.
- AutoGLM Rumination is available for free, unlike Manus’ subscription model.
- Zhipu was established in 2019 from Tsinghua University and claims its GLM4 model surpasses OpenAI’s GPT-4.
- In March, Zhipu secured 300 million yuan in government-backed funding.

items.title: Intel CEO shifts to custom chips as struggles continue
items.summary:
- Intel's CEO is pivoting to focus on custom chips amid ongoing challenges.
- The shift aims to address market competitiveness and operational struggles.
- This strategy comes as Intel faces increasing pressure from competitors and changing market demands.

items.title: Israeli high-tech firms raised $2.1b in Q1 2025
items.summary:
- Israeli high-tech firms raised US$2.13 billion in Q1 2025, a 24% increase from the previous year.
- The cybersecurity sector contributed significantly, accounting for 25% of funding rounds and 42% of total capital.
- Major funding rounds included US$250 million for Rapyd and Island, which made up nearly a quarter of total capital raised.
- Overall funding growth was 8% compared to Q1 2024, despite a 10% drop in completed funding rounds (totaling 96).
- There was an increase in follow-on investments, indicating support for existing companies.
- Analysts suggest Google's acquisition of Wiz for US$32 billion has boosted confidence in the tech sector.

items.title: Tinder introduces AI-driven in-app game to attract Gen Z
items.summary:
- Tinder has launched "The Game Game," an AI-driven in-app game for iOS users in the US.
- Users engage with chatbots in romantic comedy scenarios, simulating meet-cute situations.
- Each game session lasts three minutes, with players allowed up to five plays per day.
- The game is an experiment, not a replacement for human interaction, with safeguards in place.
- The initiative aims to help users practice conversations and build confidence, catering to Gen Z users who comprise half of Tinder's user base.
- Tinder has faced challenges with subscriber declines since 2023, hoping for brand revenue growth by 2027.

items.title: GlobalFoundries, Taiwan’s UMC in talks for potential merger
items.summary:
- GlobalFoundries is in discussions for a merger with Taiwan's UMC to enhance older semiconductor manufacturing capabilities.
- The merger is valued at approximately $37 billion but may face financial challenges for GlobalFoundries.
- Geopolitical factors and potential regulatory resistance from Taiwan's government could complicate the merger process.

items.title: Substack launches scrollable video feed to compete with TikTok
items.summary:
- Substack introduces a scrollable video feed feature.
- This new feature aims to compete with TikTok's popular video format.
- The launch reflects Substack's strategy to enhance user engagement and content delivery.

items.title: SoftBank eyes $16.5b loan for US AI projects
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp. is negotiating a US$16.5 billion loan for AI projects in the US, its largest dollar loan.
- The proposed bridge loan is still early in discussions with banks and details may yet change.
- This financing supports SoftBank’s US$500 billion AI infrastructure project, with partnerships including OpenAI and Oracle.
- The loan could enable SoftBank's participation in a US$40 billion funding round for OpenAI, potentially valuing it at US$300 billion.
- Recent developments include major investments and plans for AI parks and data centers in the US.

items.title: OpenAI nets $40b in funding, hits $300b valuation
items.summary:
- OpenAI has raised US$40 billion in funding, increasing its valuation to US$300 billion.
- Funding round led by SoftBank, with investments from Microsoft, Coatue, Altimeter, and Thrive Capital.
- This is the largest AI funding round to date, nearly doubling from a previous valuation of US$157 billion in October 2024.
- US$10 billion already invested; remaining US$30 billion expected by the end of 2025.
- Key developments include OpenAI needing to go for-profit by 2025 to secure the funding, and expected cash flow positivity by 2029 with projected revenues of $125 billion.

items.title: Alphabet’s AI drug discovery firm Isomorphic Labs bags $600m
items.summary:
- Isomorphic Labs, an AI-driven drug discovery company by Alphabet Inc., raised $600 million in its first external funding round.
- The funding was led by Thrive Capital, with participation from Alphabet and GV.
- Founded in 2021 and spun out from DeepMind, Isomorphic Labs is led by Demis Hassabis.
- In 2024, Isomorphic announced partnerships with Novartis AG and Eli Lilly & Co.
- No disclosure of the company's valuation was made after this funding round.

items.title: Strategy buys 22,048 bitcoins for $1.92b
items.summary:
- Bitcoin treasury company Strategy acquired 22,048 bitcoins for US$1.92 billion from Mar. 24 to Mar. 30.
- The acquisition price averaged US$86,969 per bitcoin.
- Strategy's total bitcoin holdings now exceed 528,000 BTC, valued at over US$43 billion, with a total cost of approximately US$35.63 billion and an average purchase price of US$67,458 per bitcoin.
- Funding for the purchases came from sales of Strategy's class A common stock (MSTR) and perpetual preferred stock (STRK), raising about US$1.2 billion and US$18.52 million, respectively.

items.title: Microsoft closes Shanghai AI lab, marking pullback in China
items.summary:
- Microsoft has closed its IoT & AI Insider Lab in Shanghai's Zhangjiang hi-tech zone.
- The lab supported 258 projects with nearly 100 companies and trained close to 10,000 professionals since its opening in May 2019.
- Over 50 enterprises supported by the lab attracted over 9.4 billion yuan in external investments by June 2024.
- The facility has been closed since January or February 2024, with no official comment from Microsoft.
- This closure is part of a broader pullback from the Chinese market amid rising geopolitical tensions, including previous layoffs and store closures in China.
- Microsoft's revenue from the Chinese market is only 1.5% of its global earnings according to company president Brad Smith.

items.title: Ex-software company Monday.com exec joins VC firm Entrée Capital
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Yoni Osherov appointed general partner at Entrée Capital on Mar. 31.
- Previously chief revenue officer at monday.com, helped grow revenue from $10 million to over $1 billion.
- Instrumental in taking monday.com public in 2021.
- Prior experience at Verint, managing a $60 million unit in speech and text analytics.
- Entrée Capital, founded in 2010, manages $1.25 billion across nine funds, with over 180 companies in its portfolio.

items.title: Procurement startup LightSource nets $33m amid tariff risks
items.summary:
- Procurement startup LightSource raised $33 million in funding.
- The investment comes amid ongoing tariff risks affecting the industry.
- Details regarding the investors or the use of funds were not disclosed.
- The company's focus is on enhancing supply chain efficiencies.

items.title: San Francisco startup Chef Robotics nets $43.1m for meal assembly
items.summary:
- Chef Robotics has secured $43.1 million in funding to enhance its meal assembly technology.
- The funding round aims to boost the company's operational capabilities and expand its market presence.
- Chef Robotics focuses on automating meal preparation for various food establishments.

items.title: Arm aims for 50% market share in data center CPUs by 2025
items.summary:
- Arm Holdings aims to capture 50% of the global data center CPU market by 2025, up from 15% in 2024.
- Mohamed Awad, Arm’s infrastructure chief, cites rising AI demand as a growth driver.
- Arm CPUs are energy-efficient and manage operations among AI processors in data centers.
- Owned by Japan’s SoftBank Group, Arm licenses its technology and earns royalties from major companies.
- x86 chips from Intel and AMD have dominated, but there's a shift towards Arm-based systems.
- Major firms like Amazon, Google, and Microsoft have adopted Arm technology for data center CPUs.
- Amazon revealed that over half of its chips in the last two years were designed using Arm's technology.

items.title: United Airlines gains approval for first Starlink-equipped planes
items.summary:
- United Airlines has received FAA approval for its first aircraft equipped with Starlink technology.
- The Embraer 175 is the first model to obtain a Supplemental Type Certificate, with deployment set for May.
- United plans to install Starlink on approximately 40 regional jets monthly, aiming for complete installation on 300 Embraer 175 planes by year-end.
- The airline is also pursuing FAA approval for over 16 additional aircraft models in collaboration with Starlink.

items.title: Xiaomi’s first EV model achieves 29k March deliveries
items.summary:
- Xiaomi delivered over 29,000 units of its first electric vehicle, the SU7, in March.
- The company aims for an annual delivery target of 350,000 units.
- This milestone marks a significant achievement for Xiaomi Auto, which has been in the EV market for only one year.
- Production ramp-up is on track, indicating confidence in meeting full-year goals.
- Recent developments include plans to expand the EV factory in Beijing and a $5.27 billion share placement for expansion and tech investment.

items.title: France fines Apple $162m over app tracking transparency
items.summary:
- France's Competition Authority fined Apple 150 million euros (US$162 million) for its App Tracking Transparency (ATT) feature.
- The authority claims ATT unfairly disadvantages third-party publishers and advertising services.
- ATT, introduced in 2021, requires user consent for tracking users across apps and websites, limiting data access for targeted ads if declined.
- Apple argues that ATT enhances user privacy and control.

items.title: Facebook Ads Promote Illegal West Bank Settlements
items.summary:
- Al Jazeera's investigation revealed over 100 Facebook ads promoting illegal settlements and far-right activities in the West Bank.
- Ads included calls for demolishing Palestinian homes and fundraising for Israeli military units in Gaza.
- Meta, Facebook's parent company, stated the ads were reviewed but did not clarify if promoting illegal settlements violated their standards.
- Investigation found 52 ads from Israeli companies selling properties in West Bank settlements, targeting buyers in Israel, the UK, and the US.
- Meta's ad review system may have failed to detect the illegal content due to its reliance on both automated technology and human oversight.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- A curated list of fundraising startups for subscribers is offered.
- Startups can sign up for listing to attract investors through email notifications.
- Investors can receive curated listings of fundraising startups through subscription.
- The article suggests reaching out if a startup succeeds in fundraising for potential coverage.

items.title: Foxconn to double iPhone production in India to 30 million units
items.summary:
- Foxconn plans to double iPhone production in India to 25-30 million units by 2025.
- The Bengaluru facility is being tested for large-scale production capabilities.
- The facility will have the capacity to assemble 20 million smartphones annually.
- Foxconn is investing 25,000 crore rupees (US$3 million) into the Bengaluru plant, making it the largest in India and the second largest globally.

items.title: Yahoo appoints ex-Paramount exec as new chief marketing officer
items.summary:
- Yahoo has appointed a former Paramount executive as its new Chief Marketing Officer.
- The decision aims to enhance Yahoo's marketing strategy and brand positioning.
- This move comes as part of Yahoo's ongoing efforts to revitalize its brand and improve market competitiveness.

items.title: Japan boosts funding by $5.4b for Rapidus advanced chip push
items.summary:
- The Japanese government has announced an additional 800 billion yen (US$5.4 billion) for Rapidus, increasing total support to US$11.5 billion.
- Rapidus plans to mass-produce advanced 2-nanometer chips, with prototype production starting in April at its Hokkaido facility.
- The funding will assist in acquiring equipment, raw materials, and implementing production technologies.
- Japan's industry ministry confirmed the funds aim to strengthen Rapidus’ production capabilities.
- A proposed bill could make the government a shareholder in Rapidus and allocate an additional 100 billion yen (US$668 million) if passed.

items.title: Ola Electric boosts battery, EV charging units with fresh funding
items.summary:
- Ola Electric secures 199 crore rupees (US$23.3 million) funding for its battery subsidiary, Ola Cell Technologies (OCT).
- The funding will convert 61.2 crore (US$7.2 million) in outstanding payables into compulsory convertible preference shares (CCPS).
- Ola Electric is also investing 3.5 crore rupees (US$410,000) into its charging infrastructure subsidiary, Ola Electric Charging (OEC).

items.title: Taiwan to rank among top semiconductor equipment spenders
items.summary:
- Taiwan is projected to be among the top spenders on semiconductor equipment globally.
- The rise in spending is attributed to increasing demand for advanced chips.
- This reflects Taiwan's significant position in the global semiconductor supply chain.

items.title: Companies reevaluate DEI initiatives during Trump policies
items.summary:
- Many US companies are reevaluating their Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives in response to President Trump’s policies.
- Changes include modifications in hiring practices and employee resource groups.
- Companies like Google and McDonald’s have adjusted their DEI programs to align with the current administration’s stance and to comply with new regulations.

items.title: US-based microservices platform Temporal raises $146m series C
items.summary:
- Seattle-based Temporal raised US$146 million in Series C funding led by Tiger Global.
- The funding round brings total funding to US$350 million and values the company at US$1.72 billion.
- Temporal specializes in microservices orchestration, aiding businesses in streamlining payment processing and infrastructure management.
- New funds will be allocated for R&D, AI initiatives, cloud services for Azure, and expanding sales and marketing.
- Notable users of Temporal’s platform include Nvidia, Box, Snap, Stripe, and Instacart.

items.title: NFT marketplace X2Y2 to shut down by April 2025
items.author: TP
items.summary:
- X2Y2, an NFT marketplace launched in February 2022, will shut down on April 30, 2025.
- Announcement made by pseudonymous founder TP in a blog post.
- Shutdown follows declining trading volumes and competition from platforms like Blur.
- X2Y2's peak monthly trading volume was US$209 million in May 2022.
- The NFT market has experienced a 90% drop in overall trading since 2021.
- X2Y2's smart contracts will remain active post-shutdown, allowing user interaction.

items.title: Nvidia-backed AI firm’s stock falls 7% below IPO price to $37
items.summary:
- CoreWeave’s stock fell 7% to US$37, below its IPO price of US$40.
- The company debuted at US$39 and closed at US$40 on Mar. 28.
- CoreWeave raised US$1.5 billion in its IPO, the largest tech listing since UiPath's US$1.57 billion in 2021.
- It is the first AI-focused firm to go public in a slow IPO market.
- Initially aimed to raise US$2.5 billion at a per share price of US$47-US$55 but reduced its offering to 37.5 million shares from 49 million due to market conditions.

items.title: Israeli foodtech startup PoLoPo develops potato-based egg protein
items.summary:
- PoLoPo is developing plant-based technology to produce egg proteins using genetically engineered potatoes.
- The startup has completed its first field trial, yielding five tons of protein-rich potatoes.
- It generates several hundred grams of protein samples monthly for initial collaborations with food companies.
- The company aims to create a stable egg protein supply to reduce disruptions like bird flu outbreaks.
- PoLoPo plans to expand to the US, with its first field trial scheduled for 2026.

items.title: Swedish EV battery firm Northvolt cuts workforce to 1,700
items.summary:
- Northvolt AB is in bankruptcy, reducing its workforce from 7,000 to 1,700 employees.
- Operations have been scaled back to facilitate a potential sale of the business.
- The company recently put its assets up for sale under court direction.
- Founded in 2016, Northvolt raised around US$10 billion but faced significant operational challenges and rising liabilities.

items.title: Australian software firm appoints directors for compliance
items.summary:
- WiseTech Global has appointed Chris Charlton and Andrew Harrison as independent non-executive directors to its board.
- The appointments restore compliance with exchange regulations for its audit and risk committee.
- This follows a breach of listing rules due to the departure of four independent non-executive directors, including former Chairman Richard Dammery, occurring after the company's half-year results in February.

items.title: Indian edtech firm PlanetSpark achieves cash-flow positivity
items.summary:
- PlanetSpark, backed by Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal, achieved cash-flow positivity in FY25.
- The startup focuses on teaching communication skills to children and professionals.
- Losses reduced by 70% from 89.5 crore rupees (US$10.5 million) in FY23 to 26.6 crore rupees (US$3.1 million) in FY24.
- Revenue grew 60% year-on-year to 67 crore rupees (US$7.8 million).
- Growth attributed to cost-cutting, customer referrals, and in-house content production.
- AI adoption enabled personalized learning, automated scoring, and improved content delivery.

items.title: US AI chipmaker secures approval on UAE ties ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- US-based Cerebras Systems Inc. resolved issues with CFIUS, clearing a hurdle for IPO plans.
- The review focused on ties to Abu Dhabi-based G42, which accounted for over 80% of revenue.
- The deal was modified to limit G42 to non-voting shares to avoid further scrutiny.
- Restrictions on AI investments from the Middle East have tightened due to national security concerns.
- Cerebras’ partnership with G42 established data centers in California, Texas, and Minnesota.
- G42 contributed 87% of revenue in early 2024, necessitating US government approval for part of the business.
- Reports suggest the IPO could raise up to US$1 billion, valuing the company at US$7 billion to US$8 billion.

items.title: Korean AI startup Wrtn raises $73.5m series B
items.summary:
- Wrtn, a South Korean AI startup, raised 108 billion won (US$73.5 million) in Series B funding announced on Mar. 31.
- This funding sets a record as the first Korean AI service platform outside of large-language models and semiconductors to exceed 100 billion won in total investments.
- Investment includes 83 billion won from the Series B round and 25 billion won from a pre-Series B round nine months prior.
- Key investors include Goodwater Capital, BRV Capital Management, Capstone Partners, among others.
- Wrtn's chat-based AI service has grown rapidly, achieving over 5 million monthly active users by October 2024.
- Monthly sales increased from 1 billion won in November 2023 to 2 billion won in December 2023.

items.title: Trump optimistic about TikTok deal before deadline
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump believes a deal for TikTok's sale may be completed before the April 5 deadline.
- The deadline, established by a 2024 law, requires TikTok to secure a non-Chinese buyer due to national security concerns.
- Trump mentioned optimism in negotiations, indicating there are potential buyers for TikTok's US operations.
- Blackstone and other non-Chinese stakeholders are reportedly leading the bid for TikTok.

items.title: Baidu’s Apollo Go, UAE mobility firm partner for driverless fleet
items.summary:
- Baidu’s Apollo Go partners with UAE-based Autogo for the largest driverless fleet in Abu Dhabi.
- Initial trials with autonomous vehicles to begin in select areas, aiming for full operations by 2026.
- Partnership ensures regulatory compliance with Abu Dhabi’s Integrated Transport Centre for smart mobility goals.
- Apollo Go, China's largest robotaxi platform, operates in over 10 cities and has a pilot license in Hong Kong.
- Service has completed 150 million kilometers and 10 million rides globally, promoting all-electric transport and reducing emissions.

items.title: TSMC to add 7,000 tech jobs with new chip plant in Taiwan
items.summary:
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) is creating 7,000 new technology jobs with a fabrication plant in Kaohsiung, Taiwan.
- The facility will produce advanced 2-nanometer chips, with volume production starting in the second half of this year.
- TSMC reaffirms commitment to Taiwan as its core operational base despite global expansion efforts.
- Taiwan Premier Cho Jung-tai emphasizes TSMC’s importance to the national economy and its role as a supplier for companies like Nvidia, Apple, and Qualcomm.
- The new plant aims to address the rising global demand for semiconductors amidst geopolitical concerns.
